action.action-desc: Mrs. Lowey (for herself, Mr. Blumenauer, Mr. Cartwright, Mr. Cohen, Mr. Connolly, Mr. Grijalva, Mr. McGovern, Mr. Pocan, Mr. Rangel, Ms. Schakowsky, Mr. Engel, Mr. Van Hollen, Mr. Hastings, and Mr. Meeks) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To end the use of body-gripping traps in the National Wildlife Refuge System.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Refuge From Cruel Trapping Act.

section.header: Possession or use of body-gripping trap prohibited
section.text: The National Wildlife Refuge System Administration Act of 1966 (16 U.S.C. 668dd et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Possession or use of body-gripping trap prohibited

subsection.text: No person may possess or use a body-gripping trap in the System.
Notwithstanding section 4(f), a person who possesses or uses a body-gripping trap in the System shall be subject to the following:

paragraph.text: In the case of a first offense, a civil fine of not more than $500 imposed by the Secretary for each body-gripping trap possessed or used.
In the case of a subsequent offense—

subparagraph.text: a civil fine of not more than $1,000 imposed by the Secretary for each body-gripping trap possessed or used;
imprisonment for not more than 180 days; or
both a civil fine and imprisonment in accordance with subparagraphs (A) and (B).

subsection.text: Any body-gripping trap that is possessed or used in violation of this section, and any wildlife captured by the use of such trap, including the pelt or raw fur, shall be subject to forfeiture to the United States in accordance with the provisions of chapter 46 of title 18, United States Code, relating to civil forfeitures.

subsection.header: Payment of court costs and other associated expenses
subsection.text: A person found to be in violation of subsection (a) shall pay all court costs associated therewith.
Not later than 120 days after the date of the enactment of this section, the Secretary shall issue any regulations necessary to carry out this section.
As used in this section, the term body-gripping trap—

paragraph.text: except as provided in paragraph (3), means any device that is intended to kill or capture wildlife by physically restraining any part of the animal;

subparagraph.text: steel-jaw, padded, or other modified leghold trap;
